title: ℓ-adic sheaf
summary: In algebraic geometry, an ℓ-adic sheaf on a Noetherian scheme X is an inverse system consisting of Z / ℓ n {\displaystyle \mathbb {Z} /\ell ^{n}} -modules F n {\displaystyle F_{n}} in the étale topology and F n + 1 → F n {\displaystyle F_{n+1}\to F_{n}} inducing F n + 1 ⊗ Z / ℓ n + 1 Z / ℓ n → ≃ F n {\displaystyle F_{n+1}\otimes _{\mathbb {Z} /\ell ^{n+1}}\mathbb {Z} /\ell ^{n}{\overset {\simeq }{\to }}F_{n}} .[1][2]
